snippet: Rich Gaelic history, in the form of fiddling and dance, is on display each year at Celtic Colours International Festival on Cape Breton, the Nova Scotia island....
abstract: Celtic Colours International Festival in Cape Breton, Nova Scotia, celebrates distinct regional culture that traces back to 19th-century immigrants from Scottish Highlands; 20th annual festival aims to keep musical traditions alive while incorporating new and experimental variations.
lead_paragraph: Rich Gaelic history, in the form of fiddling and dance, is on display each year at Celtic Colours International Festival on Cape Breton, the Nova Scotia island.

headline.main: Fiddling With the Past: The Secrets of Scottish Music
headline.print_headline: When Wild Fiddling Wakes a Sleepy Island
